meanings.definition: Annoy or irritate (someone) with persistent fault-finding or continuous urging.
meanings.sent1: She would always nag her brother to clean his room.
meanings.sent2: Please don't nag me about finishing my homework.
meanings.sent3: The parrot learned to nag like a pro, mimicking its owner's voice.
meanings.sent4: The dripping faucet seemed to nag at my sanity with its persistent rhythm.
meanings.sent5: The constant beep of the alarm clock nagged at her dreams, waking her up abruptly.

meanings.definition: A person who constantly finds fault or complains.
meanings.sent1: He was known as the office nag, always pointing out mistakes.
meanings.sent2: The nag in the group never seemed satisfied with anything.
meanings.sent3: The nag at the restaurant complained about every dish, making everyone uncomfortable.
meanings.sent4: The old car was like a nag, always breaking down at the worst times.
meanings.sent5: Her inner nag kept reminding her of all the things she needed to do, causing stress.
